title: Low Priority Queue...Client Crashed
body:
Hello all,

Since about early summer  I have been almost ritually, and randomly getting client crashes at the start of the loading screens before each game. Now, I've uninstalled, reinstalled, looked up on YouTube, Google, etc on how to fix crashes, but it seems to pop up every now and then. I have a decent gaming PC, which is good enough to play high resolution settings with no lag for a lot of games.

At this point it is effecting my account as I get a crash, send the report, try to rejoin, and if it doesn't work successfully on the first try I will need to restart my whole computer;  hoping my team didn't offer a remake because I was disconnected for the time being. Now, I am sitting in a Low Priority Que (10 minutes) for this, and I have no way of fixing the issue, or at least I have not found one.

If anyone could point me in the right direction, or simply give me a confirmation that I am not the only one struggling with this issue, and it has been addressed will make me feel better.

Also if there is anyway I can report these issues, so I don't get these penalized on my account for it. It would awesome.

Thank you. Have a great day.

replies.body: Based on this info, it sounds like you're getting bugsplat errors which can be caused by a lot of different factors.  Reinstalling is a good step, but you could have bad drivers or hardware as well.  You should start out with each step of our [game crash](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201761974-Bug-Splat-and-Game-Crashes+) guide.  This will help rule out possibilities as well as tune up your PC. Just do it in a custom game so you're not getting any penalties!
Yes, they were bug splats. If in theory I walk through all of this steps, updating, repairing as needed one by one will this guarantee no more bug splats?

Not a guarantee, but incredibly likely.  These steps rule out the most common possibility that are known to cause this.  There is a chance for weird and one of cases, but starting with the basics goes a long way!
